blocks.text: Limited exam for grading/following achalasia before and after treatment. Standardized 200 mL thin barium in upright LPO; note ingested volume if less than 200 mL and match on follow-up.

items: Position: Upright LPO; keep equipment and patient fixed throughout.
Contrast: 200 mL thin barium, consumed quickly if possible; if less, record volume and use same on follow-up.
Images: Single images at 1, 2, and 5 minutes after ingestion.
If all contrast clears by 2 minutes, skip 5-minute image. If contrast remains at 5 minutes, no further imaging needed.
Procedure sheet available at time of exam.
Measure barium column height at 5 minutes: parallel horizontal lines at EGJ and top of column (foam/barium interface acceptable). Consistency of landmarks is key.
Measure maximum esophageal diameter with line perpendicular to long axis at widest point; report value (used in radiological stage, and for area if needed).
Radiological stage drop-down will be in the report template.
50% height decrease between exams considered significant improvement (per note).
Key references (for images/clarity): How to Perform and Interpret Timed Barium Esophagogram - PMC; Esophageal Achalasia: Diagnostic Evaluation - PMC.
Possible endoscopic findings in achalasia: dilated/tortuous esophagus; tight GEJ; saliva retention; food stasis; esophageal candidiasis due to stasis.
